title: Arsenal news: Graeme Souness unleashes brutal takedown of Mesut Ozil | Metro News
text:
Evan Bartlett for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 11:48 am Souness won eight domestic league titles and three European Cups as a player (Getty Images) 
It’s been a sorry week for Arsenal and their beleaguered boss Arsene Wenger . 
The club were embarrassed in a 5-1 thrashing by Bayern Munich on Wednesday night and each day since has seen them come in for harsher and harsher criticism. 
While none of their players – bar Alexis Sanchez – can be proud of their efforts in mid-week, one man’s performance has come under particular scrutiny. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
Mesut Ozil may have hoped the tide of anger would have subsided by the weekend, but a quick scroll through social media websites and a listen to the conversations in the pubs of north London will have quickly put that idea to bed. 
But its not the fans on Twitter, Facebook or in the Twelve Pins where the most scathing rant about Arsenal and Ozil has come from, but this weekend’s edition of the Sunday Times . Ozil has been criticised for his performance on Wednesday night (Getty Images) 
Former Liverpool great Graeme Souness has offered up as brutal a dressing down of Arsenal as you’re likely to read all week. 
Among the 1,292 furious words – in which he warns the rest of the season could ‘get ugly’ if Arsenal don’t turn their form around – Souness picks out Ozil for particular condemnation. 
‘What we got from Arsenal epitomised all their failings,’ Souness explains of the Bayern game.
